intro: Arctotis aspera var. cuprea, commonly known as the red-flowered arctotis, is a perennial flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red to orange-yellow ray flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, silver-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its drought tolerance and long blooming period make it a valuable addition to xeriscapes.
